channel.title: Question about CPU and Bad Company 2....
channel.description: EDIT: disregard this, the 460 won't even fit in my case (yes, I mean case, not Mobo)

item.title: Question about CPU and Bad Company 2....
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Be careful if upgrading, most motherboards from the time of the Pentium D aren’t compatible with Core 2 Duos, even though it fits into the socket.

Read full topic
item.source: Question about CPU and Bad Company 2....

item.title: Question about CPU and Bad Company 2....
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
If you’re going to buy the game either way, buy it now. If it doesn’t work to your satisfaction, then just load it up when you upgrade.

Read full topic
item.source: Question about CPU and Bad Company 2....

item.title: Question about CPU and Bad Company 2....

item.title: Question about CPU and Bad Company 2....
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
The Core 2 Duo’s architecture is considerably faster than the Pentium D’s, since the Pentium D is pretty much a dual-core Pentium 4.

It wouldn’t hurt to try it out, but I can tell you that it will definitely be the bottleneck in your system. Overclocking the processor is one way to go, but if you’re using stock cooling then forget it.

Read full topic
item.source: Question about CPU and Bad Company 2....

item.title: Question about CPU and Bad Company 2....
item.dc:creator: Sarcastic_Schmaaa
item.description:
Dual Core. The minimum requirement is a Core 2 Duo at 2.0 Ghz, but I don’t know how much better that is than mine.

Read full topic
item.source: Question about CPU and Bad Company 2....
